title: US-Iran war will be massive, could last weeks; Israel may join offensive: Report
content: Tensions escalate as US officials warn of a massive, weeks-long military operation against Iran, potentially alongside Israel, targeting its nuclear and missile programs. Diplomatic talks are ongoing but face significant hurdles, with a 90% chance of kinetic action predicted by some advisors. Israel also prepares for imminent conflict.

title: 'Be powerful, abandon rest': RSS chief on 'thinking' of US, China
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat has criticised the United States and China. He stated that Western countries spread fundamentalism. Bhagwat asserted India possesses solutions to global problems. He called for accelerating 'Ghar Wapsi'. Bhagwat also urged Hindus to have at least three children. He emphasized strengthening India in all areas to become a world leader.

title: 'We've beaten India once, unlike our ex-cricketers': Shadab hits back at Afridi
content: Shadab Khan responded strongly to criticism from Mohammad Yousuf and Shahid Afridi after Pakistanâ€™s loss to India, defending senior players and the teamâ€™s process. The all-rounder cited Pakistanâ€™s lone World Cup win over India in 2021, brushed aside external criticism, and stressed that the team remains focused on winning the T20 World Cup.

title: Months after Google CEO said AI investment has 'elements of irrationality', he defends
content: Two months after warning about "elements of irrationality" in the AI investment boom, Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai switched gears at the India AI Impact Summit 2026, defending Big Tech's massive spending spree. With Google Cloud's backlog doubling to $240 billion and Gemini surpassing 750 million users, Pichai compared AI infrastructure investment to railroads and highwaysâ€”expensive bets that ultimately unlocked enormous economic value.

title: After BMC setback, Raj Thackeray meets Eknath Shinde amid MNS unease
content: Maharashtra Navnirman Sena chief Raj Thackeray met Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde in Mumbai, marking their first interaction since the BMC elections. The meeting, which covered various issues, follows MNS's support for Shinde's Shiv Sena in Kalyan-Dombivli and Shinde's praise for Thackeray's broader perspective in decision-making.

title: Zuckerberg's $2bn AI bet hits back at Altman: Manus was never built on OpenClaw
content: Manus co-founder Yichao 'Peak' Ji clarified his company's new personal agent mode is independent of OpenClaw, despite OpenAI's recent acquisition of the latter. Ji acknowledged OpenClaw's philosophical contribution to agent safety boundaries, while highlighting Manus's own robust security features. Manus is now prioritizing accessibility and natural language interaction.

title: Domestic violence case: Supreme Court issues notice to cricketer Mohammad Shami on wife's plea
content: The Supreme Court has directed cricketer Mohammad Shami to respond to his estranged wife's plea to transfer multiple cases, including a domestic violence one, from West Bengal to Delhi.  The court issued notices to Shami and others, seeking their replies on the transfer petitions. This follows an earlier plea for increased maintenance for their daughter.

title: 'Join Galgotias as Professor of Spin': Mahua jabs Vaishnaw amid robodog row
content: â€‹Mahua Moitra also shared a Vaishnaw's deleted X post in which he had purportedly praised the Galgotias University's robodog, which triggered a massive backlash online over its Chinese origins. â€‹ In the post, as was posted by the TMC leader, Vaishnaw had said: "Bharat's sovereign models are performing well on global benchmarks."

title: â€˜Kya karoge jaan keâ€™: Murdered MBA studentâ€™s boyfriend shows no remorse, smirks at reporters
content: Accused in the murder of an MBA student displayed striking indifference during a crime scene reconstruction, brushing aside reporters' questions. Police described his demeanor as unusually calm and detached, noting his claims of wanting to communicate with the victim's spirit and his consumption of occult content.

title: Google AI CEO tells everyone why Gemini & ChatGPT winning International Maths Olympiad is not big
content: Google AI CEO Demis Hassabis stated that AI systems solving complex Maths Olympiad problems do not prove general intelligence. These systems can still err on basic math and are 'frozen' after training. They struggle with long-term strategies and consistency across tasks. Hassabis emphasized the need for AI that learns continuously and plans for the future.

title: Ramadan Mubarak 2026: Messages to share with your friends & families
content: Ramadan 2026 begins around February 18-19 in India, marking a period of fasting, prayer, and reflection for Muslims. This sacred month, one of Islam's pillars, emphasizes spiritual growth and community. It culminates in Eid ul-Fitr on March 19-20, a joyous festival celebrating the end of the fast.

title: Three ducks in a row: Abhishek out for zero vs NED; yet to score a run in T20 WC
content: Abhishek Sharma's T20 World Cup campaign hit a new low as he registered his third consecutive duck against the Netherlands. The left-handed batter was dismissed for a first-ball duck by Aryan Dutt. India, having already qualified for the Super Eights, elected to bat first in their final group stage match.

title: Sahibzada Farhan: Once made documentary on hitting sixes off Bumrah, now a World Cup centurion
content: Never short of headlines, Sahibzada Farhan completed a full-circle moment with a scintillating T20 World Cup century against Namibia in Colombo. From challenging selection norms and going unsold in the PSL to becoming only Pakistanâ€™s second World Cup centurion. Pakistan defeated Namibia by 102 runs to cement their place in the Super Eight

title: Maruti Suzuki e-Vitara full price list revealed: Check variant-wise pricing, features
content: Features-wise, it gets a 10.25-inch digital instrument cluster, a 10.1-inch infotainment screen supported by wireless Android Auto and Apple CarPlay, cloud-based navigation, panoramic sunroof, ambient lighting with 12 colour options and ventilated front seats. Apart from that, it gets features such as wireless charging, a JBL sound system, automatic climate control, multiple USB ports, and an in-cabin air purifier.

title: Ryan Williams, 19, engaged to Alexis Hill, 25 amid breakout season
content: Alabama wide receiver Ryan Williams, 19, announced his engagement to 25-year-old Alexis Hill on Valentineâ€™s Day. Hill, who has one child from a previous relationship, shared photos of her ring on Instagram. NFL insider Dov Kleiman reported the news on X, leading to mixed reactions online. Some fans celebrated, while others debated the coupleâ€™s six-year age gap.

title: Sit, stay, run: Dog gatecrashes Olympic sprint, crosses finish line - watch
content: A surprise guest stole the show at the Milan-Cortina Winter Games. An unregistered dog dashed onto the cross-country ski course during the women's team free sprint. The enthusiastic canine chased competitors, even crossing the finish line. Officials eventually intervened, escorting the four-legged interloper off the piste. His unscheduled Olympic bid ended abruptly.

title: Diamond-shaped house in Hyderabad turns luxury real estate into legacy
content: Hyderabad's real estate boasts a unique diamond-shaped house. This structure represents P. P. Reddy's journey from humble beginnings to infrastructure giant. Its design mirrors ambition and success. Such landmark homes derive value from unique architecture, prime location, and compelling personal narratives. This residence stands as a testament to persistence and vision, a biography etched in stone and steel.

title: More trouble for Galgotias University? After Chinese robodog, Korean soccer drone
content: Galgotias University is under renewed scrutiny at the India AI Impact Summit. Following controversy over a robotic dog, the institution now faces questions about a drone soccer arena. Faculty claimed it as an in-house innovation, but social media users point to similar commercially available products from South Korea. The university was asked to vacate its stall at the summit.

title: Pakistan in T20 World Cup Super 8, become eighth team to advance
content: Pakistan secured their Super Eight spot in the ICC T20 World Cup 2026, becoming the final qualifier. They joined powerhouses like India, West Indies, and England in the next phase. The tournament's top two from each group have advanced, setting up two exciting groups of four for the Super 8 stage.

title: 'India doesn't negotiate as a meek nation': Piyush Goyal on recent trade deals
content: Piyush Goyal revealed India's ambitious economic diplomacy, emphasising engagement and trust to achieve trade success.  He highlighted the nation's goal of becoming a $30-35 trillion economy by 2047, stressing the need for global integration.  Goyal noted India's recent success in securing trade agreements from a position of strength, while safeguarding national interests.

title: AI boom! What Nvidia wants from India to put New Delhi on the global manufacturing map
content: NVIDIA's Shanker Trivedi urged India to boost AI infrastructure investment beyond $1.2 billion, aligning with global standards. He highlighted the Union Budget's 20-year tax holiday for foreign firms as a significant chance to build foundational AI capacity. With 1,800 global corporations operating in India, each requiring local AI factories, increased capital allocation is crucial for developing intelligence-led business processes.

title: Sahibzada Farhan scripts history, becomes only 2nd Pakistan batter to achieve this feat
content: Sahibzada Farhan made history by scoring a century in the T20 World Cup. He is the second Pakistani batter to achieve this milestone. Farhan's century helped Pakistan post a strong total against Namibia. This performance was crucial for Pakistan's hopes of advancing in the tournament. The team made changes to its lineup for this important match.

title: 'Was anxious about her future after my death': Former Isro employee murders wife in Bengaluru flat
content: A former ISRO employee, Nagesh Ishwar Rao, was arrested in Bengaluru for allegedly strangling his wife, Sandhya Shri, to death. Police revealed Rao cited anxieties about his wife's future as his motive. The couple's daughter, residing in the US, has been notified. An investigation into the tragic incident is ongoing.

title: Nandan Nilekani says AI is ending these 4 IT jobs â€” and creating 5 new roles soon
content: Infosys Chairman Nandan Nilekani declared AI is fundamentally reshaping tech jobs, shifting focus from coding to managing AI agents. This "root-and-branch" transformation demands new skills in AI engineering and orchestration, while roles like front-end developers and QA testers are expected to shrink. Companies face the challenge of reskilling their workforce for these evolving AI-centric roles.

title: Chinese robodog row at AI Impact Summit: Why is Galgotias University under fire? Explained
content: Galgotias University was asked to leave the AI Summit Expo after showcasing a Chinese-made robotic dog as an in-house innovation. The university clarified it did not build the robot but used it to inspire students, sparking a debate on domestic AI development versus global technology adoption.

title: NHL trade news: St. Louis Blues likely to undergo major rebuild
content: The St. Louis Blues are at a crossroads as general manager Doug Armstrong is at a juncture where he has to decide whether to go for a late-season surge or a complete rebuild. The coming month will be very important for the team, as well-placed trades and recall decisions could change the course of their history.

title: Dwarka car accident aftermath video shows brother-sister duo shifting blame on biker
content: New CCTV and mobile footage has emerged from the fatal Dwarka South crash, showing a brother and sister arguing with bystanders after the collision that killed biker Sahil Dhaneshra. The SUV, allegedly driven by a minor, had narrowly avoided a bus before hitting the motorcycle and a stationary car.

title: Traveller shares why some foreigners arenâ€™t big fan of Indian tourists
content: An Indian traveler's experience in Vietnam highlighted how certain Indian tourists' behaviors, like aggressive bargaining and queue-jumping, negatively impacted local perceptions. Similar incidents shared by other Indians abroad underscore a recurring issue of civic sense translating poorly across borders, leading to international stereotypes.

title: Live stream to wall climbs: Bihar Class X board exams open in chaos
content: Bihar School Examination Board exams commenced with significant disruptions. A Facebook Live video from a Siwan exam centre raised security concerns. Students across districts attempted to scale walls to enter centres after arriving late. Incidents of cheating were also reported. Authorities are investigating the breaches and ensuring exam integrity.

title: Why China's Gen Z are choosing to parent stuffed toys over real babies
content: Young Chinese women are embracing "painless parenthood" by raising life-sized cotton dolls, offering nurturing joy without the financial and career burdens of real motherhood. This trend, fueled by fandom and a desire for emotional fulfillment, allows them to experience motherhood's warmth and express creativity in a judgment-free environment, redefining adulthood on their own terms.

title: Four ducks in 7 innings, no problem: Abhishek Sharma remains No. 1 T20I batter
content: Abhishek Sharma holds the top spot in ICC T20I batter rankings despite recent form. Ishan Kishan has entered the top 10 after strong performances. Pathum Nissanka and Ryan Rickelton also saw significant ranking jumps. Saim Ayub is back at number one in the all-rounder rankings. Rashid Khan is closing in on the top bowling spot.

title: Super 8 spot on the line, Pakistan drop Shaheen Afridi for must-win game; here's why
content: Pakistan made a significant change, dropping fast bowler Shaheen Shah Afridi for their must-win T20 World Cup match against Namibia. The team also brought in Salman Mirza and Khawaja Nafay. This decision comes amidst criticism of senior players' recent performances and the team's precarious position in the tournament.

title: Firing at Rohit Shetty's house: 7 held for â€˜Hindu Sainik Missionâ€™ to spread fear
content: Rohit Shettyâ€™s Mumbai home was attacked on February 1. Police say the shooting was planned by the Shubham Lonkar gang, who recruited seven youths through social media with promises of money and fame. Two modules, from Pune and North India, handled logistics and execution. Several accused are now under arrest.

content: Mikaela Shiffrin put in two dominant runs to win the Olympic women's slalom by 1.50 seconds and end a wait for another medal that stretched back to 2018.

title: "Kinetic Action" In Next Few Weeks? US Preps For Iran Military Ops: Report
content: The United States could be closer to launching a full-scale attack in the Middle East than most Americans think. A report on Axios citing sources mentions that a US military operation in Iran would be a "massive, weeks-long campaign".

title: Will AI Kill Smartphones In Next 10 Years? What Nothing India Chief Told NDTV
content: Smartphones will remain the "main gateway" to the next generation of operating systems, according to Akis Evangelidis, co-founder and President of Nothing India.

title: Opportunities Or 'Losing Control'? Industry Leaders' Prediction On Future Of AI
content: Agentic AI, or artificial intelligence with immensely capable agents that act as force-multipliers, can raise concerns due to the fear of humanity losing control, industry leaders at the NDTV Ind.AI Summit said today.

title: Civic Poll Verdict Seen As Acid Test For Revanth Reddy Government
content: The polls were held on February 12, and elections to the posts of chairpersons, mayors and their deputies were completed on February 16, with voting in 11 municipalities postponed by the State Election Commission.

title: AI A Knife, It Can Be Used To Butter Bread Or Kill: Norway Minister To NDTV
content: Norway's Minister of Digitalisation and Public Governance Karianne Oldernes Tung believes India's AI Impact Summit has sent a powerful signal to the world: that the future of AI must be collaborative, inclusive and grounded in trust.

title: Sarpanch From AAP Shot Dead At Wedding In Punjab's Tarn Taran
content: A sarpanch from a village in Punjab's Tarn Taran, belonging to the ruling Aam Aadmi Party, was shot dead by two unidentified assailants during a wedding.

title: South African Cheetah Gamini Births 5 Cubs, Number In Kuno Park Now 38
content: On the third anniversary of the arrival of South African cheetahs in India, a female cheetah translocated from South Africa, has given birth to three healthy cubs inside Madhya Pradesh's Kuno National Park.

content: Amid the rising controversy over Galgotias University allegedly presenting Chinese-made robotic dog as its own invention at the AI Impact Summit, LoP Lok Sabha Rahul Gandhi called it a "disorganised PR spectacle".

content: Rishi Sunak, the former Prime Minister of the United Kingdom, told NDTV today that his use of AI even includes lesson preps for his daughter's school-level physics.

title: "Chernobyl-Scale Disaster" Warning In AI Guru Stuart Russell's Note To World
content: The world does not have an answer yet to what would happen to humanity if machines start 'thinking', UC Berkeley professor Stuart Russell said at the NDTV Ind.AI Summit today.

content: Two American carrier strike groups are now positioned within operational reach of Iran. One, the USS Abraham Lincoln, has been tracked roughly 700 kilometres from the Iranian coastline.

content: At a time when artificial intelligence is rapidly reshaping geopolitics, defence, and global commerce, the scale and ambition of India's AI Impact Summit in New Delhi has sent a strong signal to the world.

content: Pointing out that there is a very high adoption of, and optimism for, AI technologies in India, Pichai said they present a chance for the country to "leapfrog age-old gaps" and create new opportunities.
